Very nicely built mobile bases. Yeah, they're definitely not hard to make. The non-mobile modular varieties on the other hand (no wheels) are much harder as you have to be precise and maintain control at all times (once established, make sure SAS is turned off).

Edit: One thing that could make non-mobile ones easier to place is landing gears (which others have done in the past). Especially handy for stabilization.

Edited October 20, 2014 by Bandock
Additional notes.

Science was fun but there's only so many times u can do the same things over & over again. I like the new challenge of keeping things cheap but capable. Also the added challenge of no reverts. That need has me testing in sandbox to use in career.

The mobile base while fun is not that practical as most people are more likely to fly from one biome to another rather then spend ages roving at low speeds on the surface. I believe this is the main reason its not that popular.
